modules.description: Provides operations to create and manipulate vector kinds, including a constant value `vk` representing a specific vector type. Works with the `t` type, which encapsulates vector kind information. Used to enforce type-specific behaviors in low-level code generation and optimization passes.

Provides operations to manipulate unsigned 8-bit bigarrays organized into planes, including access and transformation functions for each plane. Works with the `t` type, which represents a collection of planes storing pixel or data channels. Used for image processing tasks requiring per-plane manipulation, such as color channel separation or blending.

Provides operations to manipulate a single packed array of 8-bit unsigned integers, including access and modification of individual elements. Works with custom types `plane` and `t` that encapsulate the array structure and associated metadata. Used for efficient storage and traversal of large datasets, such as image pixel data or binary file contents.

Handles video frame initialization and manipulation using AVFrame structures from FFmpeg. Provides access to core frame properties and metadata through low-level bindings. Used for processing raw video data in multimedia applications.

Provides operations for manipulating arrays of string-int pairs, including accessing and modifying elements. Works with the t type, which is an array of tuples containing a string and an integer. Used to manage structured data in applications requiring indexed string-value associations.

Provides functions for decoding and encoding video streams, manipulating audio samples, and extracting metadata from multimedia files. Works with data types such as video frames, audio buffers, and container formats like MP4 and MKV. Used to convert video formats, apply real-time audio filters, and analyze media file properties.

Provides functions to configure and manipulate video scaling parameters using vector-based operations. Works with custom data types representing video frames and scaling configurations. Used to adjust resolution and format conversions in real-time video processing pipelines.
